result.execSummary:
The defendant Isiah T Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for employment

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA specimen; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and  surcharges; payable in 1 year or Civil Judgment. Court waived all non mandatory costs due to inability to pay.

- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms during the term of probation.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Attend a Firearms Safety Course. Defendant may possess firearms for purposes of the class.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavioral Modification Program.
COURT WILL ALLOW EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isiah T Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isiah T Wright in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Isiah T Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 


SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY  time served. Huber privileges to apply for employment.
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.
    
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and  surcharges. Payable in 1 year or Civil Judgment.
* Defendant to provide DNA specimen and pay DNA surcharge.
* Court waived all non mandatory costs due to inability to pay. 
* Attend a firearms safety course. Defendant may possess firearms for purposes of the class.
* No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms during the term of probation. 
* No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
* Successfully complete a cognitive thinking/behavioral modification program. 
* Maintain/Obtain Full time Employment. 
* Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of probation. 
* Appellate Rights given. 


AS TO COUNT 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant Isiah T Wright in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense request a resolution date.. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Isiah T Wright in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isiah T Wright in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/03/2022@02:30pm
